name: capacitor production, tantalum-, for through-hole mounting | capacitor, tantalum-, for through-hole mounting | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/2171/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of tantalum capacitors for the through-hole mounting technology. It is based on the assumption that a typical tantalum ceramic capacitor has an average weight of 0.254 g.The data represent a typical tantalum-capacitor for the hole-through mounting technology, used in the information and communication technology. Material data are taken from datasheets of producers of such capacitors. Infrastructure and production efforts are based on own assumptions. The production efforts represent not a specific capacitor type and have thus, accordingly higher uncertainties.

From reception of metals and plastics at the factory gate.

This dataset includes raw material input and production efforts for the production of currently used tantalum-containing capacitors for hole-through mounting technology.
category: C:Manufacturing/26:Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products/261:Manufacture of electronic components and boards/2610:Manufacture of electronic components and boards

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data represent a global valuable composition of tantalum-containing capacitors.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: average production composed of: formulation; build-up process; cutting; bisquing; Pre-Firing; Firing; Tumbling; Termination (SMT) resp. metallization; slitting; winding; metal spray; heat treatment; sawing; lead welding; epoxy filling (THT)

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=GLO
Tantalum capacitor offers a large capacitance to volume ratio, smaller size, good stability, a wide operating temperature range, and a long reliable operating life. (Wikipedia, 2007)

flow.name: capacitor, tantalum-, for through-hole mounting
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/26:Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products/261:Manufacture of electronic components and boards/2610:Manufacture of electronic components and boards

exchanges.description:
Calculated Value. The production of 1 kg of capacitors lead to a waste amount of 0.48 kg unused raw materials. Hence, this dataset here has an input of 1.48 kg of raw materials per kg of capacitor. The split to the different raw materials (metals, plastics, etc.) is based on the reported  material specifications.
EcoSpold01Location=GLO
